securitygame

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • securitygame.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    Network class is used for generating a network. Game master will use this class to generate a network.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Network() 
      Network(int networkName)
      Constructor used by Game master to initialize network.
      Network(int networkName, int numNodes)
      Constructor used by Game master to initialize network.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addHoneypot(int sv, int pv, int[] neighbors)
      Adds Honeypot in the network by creating a new node with neighbors
      void addMoreEdges(int routerIndex, int[][] adjacencyMatrix)
      Adds edges to the node.
      void generateNetwork()
      Generates a random network based on the parameter class and prints it in a file
      int getName()
      Returns network name.
      Node getNode(int nodeId)
      Returns node with nodeId
      int getSize()
      Returns size of the network
      boolean isAllowedToBeNeighbor(int currentIndex, int neighborIndex, int[][] adjacencyMatrix)
      Returns boolean validating a node to be eligible for Neighbor or not.
      void printHiddenNetwork()
      Print hidden network in a file.
      void printNetwork()
      Print network in a file

      Sets network name.

      Shuffles all the nodes in the network.

      • isAllowedToBeNeighbor

        public boolean isAllowedToBeNeighbor(int currentIndex,
                            int neighborIndex,
                            int[][] adjacencyMatrix)
        Returns boolean validating a node to be eligible for Neighbor or not. This method checks whether the neighborIndex is itself or whether the number of neighbor is within range
        Parameters:
        currentIndex - An integer indicates current node id
        neighborIndex - An integer indicates neighbor node id
        adjacencyMatrix - A two dimensional array for adjacency
        Returns:
        boolean True/False validating a node to be eligible for Neighbor or not

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns size of the network
        Returns:
        size of the network i.e. number of total nodes

      • addHoneypot

        public void addHoneypot(int sv,
               int pv,
               int[] neighbors)
        Adds Honeypot in the network by creating a new node with neighbors
        Parameters:
        sv - An integer indicates security value
        pv - An integer indicates point value
        neighbors - An integer array indicates all the neighbors

      • printHiddenNetwork

        public void printHiddenNetwork()
        Print hidden network in a file. private or unexplored nodes' rows will have -1.

        Print network in a file
